intro: Willkommia sarmentosa, commonly known as the creeping willkommia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that are typically borne on slender stems, and it has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Willkommia sarmentosa is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and unique floral display.
